translated: Abhidharma-jÃ±Äna-prasthÄna-Å›Ästra, fascicle 6ğŸ”½
Composed by Venerable Katyayaniputra
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order

In the second part of the Saá¹ƒgraha-skandha, the fourth section on the ten gates, part two: How many minds are equally and immediately born after the latent afflictions of the eye faculty up to the latent afflictions of the formless realm that are to be eliminated by cultivation in the fifteen categories of mind in the three realms?
Answer:
The eye faculty is equally and immediately followed by fifteen minds.
The faculties of equanimity, faith, and the other five are also the same.
The faculty of pleasure is equally and immediately followed by eleven minds.
The faculty of pain is equally and immediately followed by five minds.
The faculty of grief is also the same.
The faculty of joy is equally and immediately followed by ten minds.ğŸ”½The faculty of knowing that which is not yet known is not equally and immediately followed by any minds.
The faculties of knowing and fully knowing are equally and immediately followed by three minds.
The eye, ear, and body consciousness elements, etc., immediately give rise to ten minds.
The nose and tongue consciousness elements immediately give rise to five minds.
Unwholesome dharmas are also the same.
The mind, dharmas, and mind consciousness elements immediately give rise to fifteen minds.
The mind and dharma bases.ğŸ”½The last four aggregates.
The last four appropriated aggregates.
The consciousness element.
Formless, invisible, and impingeless.
Contaminated, conditioned dharmas.
Present wholesome and indeterminate.
Bound to the three realms, neither learner nor post-learner.
Dharmas abandoned by insight and cultivation are also the same.
Pure dharmas immediately give rise to three minds.
Learner, post-learner, and unabandoned dharmas are also the same.
Past dharmas immediately give rise to two minds.
Future dharmas do not give rise to minds.
The four noble truths of suffering and accumulation - immediately after - give rise to fifteen minds.
The four meditations, four formless [absorptions], and worldly cognition - also like this.
The four noble truths of the path - immediately after - give rise to three minds.
The cognition of the category, suffering, accumulation, cessation, and path.
The three samÄdhis - also like this.
The four immeasurables - immediately after - give rise to six minds.
The first, second, fourth, and fifth liberations.
The first four spheres of mastery.
The cognition of others' minds - also like this.
The third, sixth, and seventh liberations - immediately after - give rise to five minds.
The last four spheres of mastery and ten universal bases - also like this.
The eighth liberation - does not give rise to any minds.
The cognition of the law - immediately after - gives rise to two minds.
The three fetters - immediately after - give rise to fifteen minds.

The same applies to the effluents of existence and ignorance, the floods and yokes of existence and views, the last three clingings, the last two bodily ties, the fetters of pride and greed, the last three lower fetters, the last four higher fetters, the five false views, the feeling of mental contact, the last five latent afflictions, and the six fetters beginning with greed.
The three roots of unwholesomeness and the effluent of desire give rise to five minds immediately after.

The same applies to the flood and yoke of desire, the first two clingings, the first five hindrances, the fetters of anger, jealousy, and stinginess, the first two lower fetters, the feeling of contact born of nose and tongue contact, the latent afflictions of greed for desire and anger, and the fetters of anger, jealousy, and stinginess.
Greed for form and formlessness give rise to ten minds immediately after.
The last four higher fetters give rise to three minds immediately after.
The same applies to the aggregates of craving produced by eye, ear, and body contact.
The thirty-six latent afflictions of the desire realm immediately give rise to five types of mind.
The thirty-one latent afflictions of the form realm immediately give rise to ten types of mind.
The thirty-one latent afflictions of the formless realm immediately give rise to fifteen types of mind.

For each of the latent afflictions of ignorance to be eliminated through cultivation in the formless realm, should it be said to have investigation and analysis,ğŸ”½to be without investigation but only have analysis,
or to be without investigation and analysis?
Answer:
It should be said:
The latent afflictions that increase with the eye faculty have all three.
The latent afflictions that increase with the ear, nose, tongue, body, life, mind, joy, and faith faculties, etc., are also the same.
The latent afflictions that increase with the female faculty have investigation and analysis.
The same applies to the increase of the latent tendencies of the male faculty, the faculty of suffering, and the faculty of sorrow.
The increase of the latent tendencies of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, touch, mind, dharmas, and mind-consciousness elements - all three are present.

The same applies to the increase of the latent tendencies of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, touch, mind, and dharma bases, the five aggregates, the five appropriated aggregates, the six elements, the form and formless [realms], the visible and invisible, the resistant and non-resistant, the contaminated and conditioned dharmas.

The same applies to the increase of the latent tendencies of the past, future, and present, the wholesome and indeterminate, the form realm, the non-learner and non-non-learner, the views and cultivation abandonment dharmas.
The increase of the latent tendencies of the smell and taste elements, and the nose and tongue consciousness elements - all have initial and sustained thought.
The same applies to the increase of the latent tendencies of the smell and taste bases, the unwholesome, and the desire realm dharmas.
The latent tendencies that increase with the eye, ear, and body consciousness realms may have investigation and analysis.
Or they may be without investigation but only have analysis.
The latent tendencies that increase with the factors bound to the formless realm are without investigation and without analysis.
The latent tendencies that increase with the truths of suffering and accumulation have all three.

The same is true for the four immeasurables, the first two liberations, the first four aspects of mastery, the knowledge of others' minds, the knowledge of the conventional, and the three concentrations.
The latent tendencies that increase with the first meditation may have investigation and analysis.
Or they may be without investigation but only have analysis.
The latent tendencies that increase with the last three meditations are without investigation and without analysis.
The same is true for the four formless [absorptions], the last six liberations, the last four aspects of mastery, and the ten universal bases.
The latent tendencies that increase with the three bonds have all three.

The entanglements of existence and ignorance, the last three floods, bonds, and clingings, the last two bodily ties, the fetters of craving and pride, the last three fetters of the lower part, the remaining four fetters of the upper part except for craving for the formless, the five views, the sixth craving, the last five latent afflictions, and the latent afflictions that increase with the six fetters such as craving - are also like this.
The latent afflictions that increase with the three unwholesome roots have initial and sustained thought.

The floods, bonds, and clingings of the sensual realm, the first two bodily ties, the five hindrances, the fetters of anger, jealousy, and stinginess, the first two fetters of the lower part, the craving born of contact with the nose and tongue, the first two latent afflictions, and the latent afflictions that increase with the fetters of anger, jealousy, and stinginess - are also like this.
The latent afflictions that increase with craving for the formless have neither initial nor sustained thought.
The latent afflictions that increase with the craving born of contact with the eye, ear, and body may have initial and sustained thought.
Or they may have no initial thought but only sustained thought.
The latent tendencies that increase the thirty-six latent tendencies in the desire realm have initial and sustained thought.
The latent tendencies that increase the thirty-one latent tendencies in the form realm have all three.
The latent tendencies that increase the thirty-one latent tendencies in the formless realm are without initial and sustained thought.

original: çœ¼æ ¹ä¹ƒè‡³ç„¡è‰²ç•Œä¿®æ‰€æ–·ç„¡æ˜éš¨çœ ï¼Œä¸€ä¸€æ‰€å¢éš¨çœ ï¼Œç•¶è¨€æ¨‚æ ¹ã€è‹¦æ ¹ã€å–œæ ¹ã€æ†‚æ ¹ã€æ¨æ ¹ç›¸æ‡‰è€¶ï¼Ÿ
analyzed: çœ¼æ ¹ä¹ƒè‡³ç„¡è‰²ç•Œä¿®æ‰€æ–·ç„¡æ˜éš¨çœ ï¼Œä¸€ä¸€æ‰€å¢éš¨çœ ï¼Œç•¶è¨€æ¨‚æ ¹ã€è‹¦æ ¹ã€å–œæ ¹ã€æ†‚æ ¹ã€æ¨æ ¹ç›¸æ‡‰è€¶ï¼Ÿ
translated: Are the latent tendencies that increase each of the latent tendencies from the eye faculty up to the ignorance eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm associated with the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of joy, the faculty of dejection, or the faculty of equanimity?
Answer:
It should be said:
The latent tendencies that increase the eye faculty are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pain.
The latent tendencies that increase the ear, nose, tongue, body, life, pleasure, equanimity, and the five faculties beginning with faith are also like this.
The latent tendencies that increase the female faculty are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and pain.
The latent tendencies that increase the male, joy, and dejection faculties are also like this.
The latent tendencies that increase with the mind faculty are associated with five faculties.
The latent tendencies that increase with the suffering faculty are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the joy faculty.
The latent tendencies that increase with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness realms are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the suffering faculty.
The latent tendencies that increase with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body sense bases, and the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing are also the same.
The latent tendencies that increase with the form, sound, smell, taste, touch, eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousness realms are associated with five faculties.

form, sound, smell, taste, touch, mental objects, the five aggregates, the five aggregates subject to clinging, the six elements, form, formless, visible, invisible, resistant, unresistant, contaminated, conditioned phenomena, past, future, present, wholesome, unwholesome, indeterminate, bound to the desire realm, neither training nor post-training, phenomena to be eliminated by cultivation, and the proclivities that increase in relation to them are also like this.
The proclivities that increase in relation to phenomena bound to the form realm are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pain and grief.
The proclivities that increase in relation to phenomena bound to the formless realm are associated with the faculty of equanimity.
The proclivities that increase in relation to the truths of suffering and origination are associated with five faculties.
The proclivities that increase in relation to conventional knowledge are also like this.
The proclivities that increase in relation to the first absorption are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pain and grief.

The same applies to the increase of the latent afflictions associated with the faculties of joy, pleasure, and equanimity in the four boundless states of loving-kindness, compassion, and equanimity, and the cognition of others' minds.
The increase of the latent afflictions in the second concentration is associated with the faculties of joy and equanimity.
The same applies to the increase of the latent afflictions in the four boundless states of joy, the first two liberations, and the first four aspects of mastery.
The increase of the latent afflictions in the third concentration is associated with the faculties of pleasure and equanimity.
The increase of the latent afflictions in the fourth concentration is associated with the faculty of equanimity.
The same applies to the increase of the latent afflictions in the four formless concentrations, the last six liberations, the last four aspects of mastery, and the ten universal bases.
The increase of the latent afflictions in the three formless concentrations is associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pain.
The increase of the latent afflictions in the three bonds is associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pain.

The unwholesome roots of greed, the flood, the yoke, and the grasping of views, the grasping of precepts and vows, the bodily tie of sensual desire and the bodily tie of the grasping of rules and rituals, the hindrances of sensual desire and of grasping rules and rituals, the fetters of sensual desire, conceit, and pride, the fetters of sensual desire and of pride, the lower fetters of views of self, grasping rules and rituals, and doubt,

the five views, the six bases of craving, the latent tendencies of desire for sensual pleasures, conceit, views, and doubt, the fetters of craving, conceit, views, grasping, and doubt, and the latent tendencies that increase them are also like this.
The latent tendencies that increase the unwholesome root of anger are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pleasure.

The bodily tie of ill-will, the hindrance of ill-will, the fetter of ill-will, the lower fetter of ill-will, the latent tendency of ill-will, and the latent tendencies that increase the fetter of ill-will are also like this.
The latent tendencies that increase the unwholesome root of delusion are associated with five faculties.

The same applies to the outflows of desire and ignorance, the floods and bonds of desire, the grasping of desire, the hindrances of torpor and restlessness, the latent afflictions of ignorance, the fetters, and the increased latent afflictions.
The increased latent afflictions of the outflow of existence are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of suffering and grief.

The same applies to the floods and bonds of existence, the grasping of self-theory, the desire for form, restlessness, pride, and ignorance, the upper fetters, and the increased latent afflictions of the craving for existence.
The increased latent afflictions of the hindrances of sleep, remorse, and doubt are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and suffering.
The same applies to the fetters of envy and stinginess, and the increased latent afflictions of the fetters of envy and stinginess among the nine fetters.
The increased latent afflictions of desire for the formless realm are associated with the faculty of indifference.

The increased latent afflictions of all that is to be eliminated by seeing in the desire realm and that which is to be eliminated by cultivation, and the pride latent afflictions, are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pleasure and suffering.
The anusayas that are increased by the anusaya of craving to be abandoned through cultivation in the desire realm are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pain.
The anusayas that are increased by the anusaya of hatred to be abandoned through cultivation in the desire realm are associated with four faculties.
Excluding the faculty of pleasure.
The anusayas that are increased by the anusaya of ignorance to be abandoned through cultivation in the desire realm are associated with five faculties.
The anusayas that are increased by the thirty-one anusayas in the form realm are associated with three faculties.
Excluding the faculties of pain and sorrow.
The anusayas that are increased by the thirty-one anusayas in the formless realm are associated with the faculty of equanimity.
The eye faculty up to the anusayas to be abandoned through cultivation in the formless realm.
The anusaya of ignorance.
Who possesses?
Who does not possess?
Answer:ğŸ”½The eye faculty is possessed by those in the form realm and those in the desire realm who have obtained it and not lost it.
Those in the formless realm and those in the desire realm who have not yet obtained it or have already lost it do not possess it.
The ear, nose, and tongue faculties are also like this.
The body faculty is possessed in the desire and form realms.
It is not possessed in the formless realm.
The female and male faculties are possessed in the desire realm if they have been obtained and not lost.
They are not possessed in the form and formless realms, and in the desire realm if they have not been obtained or have been lost.
The faculties of life, mind, and equanimity are possessed by all sentient beings.
The faculty of pleasure is possessed by those below the heaven of universal purity and by noble ones born above.
It is not possessed by ordinary beings born above.
The faculty of pain is possessed in the desire realm.
It is not possessed in the form and formless realms.ğŸ”½The faculty of joy is possessed by those below the heaven of extreme radiance.
And by noble ones born above.
It is not possessed by ordinary beings born above.
The faculty of grief is possessed by those not yet free from the passion of desire.
It is not possessed by those already free from the passion of desire.
The five faculties such as faith are possessed by those who have not severed wholesome roots.
Those who have severed wholesome roots do not possess them.
The three pure faculties are possessed by those who have attained them and not lost them.
Those who have not attained them or have lost them do not possess them.
The eye, ear, nose, and tongue faculties, the form realm, and the desire realm are possessed by those who have attained them and not lost them.
The formless realm and the desire realm are not possessed by those who have not attained them or have lost them.
The same applies to the eye, ear, nose, and tongue sense bases.
The body, form, sound, and touch faculties are possessed in the desire and form realms.
They are not possessed in the formless realm.

The same applies to the body, form, sound, and touch sense bases, the form aggregate, the first five sense bases, phenomena with form and resistance, and phenomena bound to the desire and form realms.
The olfactory, gustatory, and olfactory and gustatory consciousness faculties are possessed in the desire realm.
They are not possessed in the form and formless realms.
The same applies to the nose and tongue faculties.
The eye, ear, and body consciousness elements are mastered below the Brahma world, and when present in the upper three meditations, but not mastered when not present, and in the formless realm.
The mind, dharmas, and mind consciousness elements are mastered by all sentient beings.
The mind and dharma faculties, the last four aggregates, the four grasping aggregates, and the consciousness element.

The formless realm is invisible, unimpeded, contaminated and uncontaminated, conditioned and unconditioned dharmas, past, future, and present, indeterminate, bound to the formless realm, neither learner nor post-learner, and dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation or not eliminated.
The form aggregate is mastered by saints in the desire, form, and formless realms.
Ordinary beings in the formless realm do not master it.
Dharmas with form are also like this.
Good dharmas are mastered by those with unbroken wholesome roots.
Those who have already severed the wholesome roots do not possess them.
Unwholesome dharmas - those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm possess them.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm do not possess them.
Learned and unlearned dharmas - those who have already attained and not lost possess them.
Those who have not yet attained or have already lost do not possess them.
Dharmas to be eliminated by insight - those who have not yet given rise to the knowledge of the class of the path possess them.
Those who have already given rise to it do not possess them.
The truths of suffering and accumulation - all sentient beings possess them.
The sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and conventional knowledge are also like this.
The truth of cessation - those who have already attained and not lost possess it.
Those who have not yet attained or have already lost it do not possess it.
The four immeasurables, eight liberations, eight spheres of mastery, ten universal bases, and knowledge of others' minds are also like this.
The truth of the path - those who have already attained possess it.
Those who have not yet attained do not possess it.

The cognition of dharmas, cognition of others' minds, cognition of suffering, cognition of origination, cognition of cessation, and cognition of the path, the three samÄdhis, and the three heavier samÄdhis are also like this.
The first dhyÄna is from the Brahma world downward.
And the noble ones born above - they attain it.
Ordinary beings born above - they do not attain it.
The second dhyÄna is from the Ä€bhÄsvara heaven downward.
And the noble ones born above - they attain it.
Ordinary beings born above - they do not attain it.
The third dhyÄna is from the Åšubhaká¹›tsna heaven downward.
And the noble ones born above - they attain it.
Ordinary beings born above - they do not attain it.
The fourth dhyÄna is from the Bá¹›hatphala heaven downward.
And the noble ones born above - they attain it.
Ordinary beings born above - they do not attain it.
The sphere of infinite space is from the sphere of infinite space downward.
And the noble ones born above - they attain it.
Ordinary beings born above - they do not attain it.
The sphere of infinite consciousness is attained by those below the sphere of infinite consciousness,
and by noble ones born above.
Ordinary beings born above do not attain it.
The sphere of nothingness is attained by those below the sphere of nothingness,
and by noble ones born above.
Ordinary beings born above do not attain it.
The fetter of the view of self exists when the knowledge of the categories of suffering has not yet arisen,
and does not exist when it has already arisen.
The fetter of the lower part of the view of self, the view of self, and the extreme view are also like this.
The fetter of clinging to precepts and vows, and the fetter of doubt exist when the knowledge of the categories of the path has not yet arisen,
and do not exist when it has already arisen.

The flood, the yoke, and the grasping of views, clinging to precepts and vows, the last two fetters, the fetter of clinging to precepts and vows and the fetter of doubt in the lower part, the last three views, the latent tendencies of views and doubt, the fetters of views, grasping, and doubt are also like this.
The three unwholesome roots are possessed by those not yet free from desire,
and not possessed by those already free from desire.

The desire realm's contaminants, floods, bonds, clingings, first two bodily ties, first four hindrances, the fetters of ill will, envy, and stinginess, the first two lower bonds, the desire for the sense objects arising from nose and tongue contact, the latent tendencies of desire for the desire realm and ill will, and the fetters of ill will, envy, and stinginess are also like this.
The contaminants of existence and ignorance are possessed by those not yet free from the defilements of the formless realm,
and not possessed by those already free from the defilements of the formless realm.

The floods and bonds of existence and ignorance, the clinging to scriptural doctrines, the fetters of craving, conceit, and ignorance, the last four upper bonds, the desire for the sense objects arising from mind contact, the latent tendencies of craving for existence, conceit, and ignorance, and the fetters of craving, conceit, and ignorance are also like this.
The hindrance of doubt is possessed by ordinary beings not yet free from desire,ğŸ”½and not possessed by those already free from desire.
And the noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm - when the knowledge of the dharmas of the path has not yet arisen - possess it.
The ordinary beings who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm, and the noble ones.
And the noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm - when the knowledge of the dharmas of the path has already arisen - do not possess it.
The fetter of attachment to the higher realms in the form realm - when one has not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm - possesses it.
When one has already abandoned the defilements of the form realm - does not possess it.
The aggregates of craving produced by eye, ear, and body contact - when one has not yet abandoned the defilements of the Brahma world - possesses it.
When one has already abandoned the defilements of the Brahma world - does not possess it.
The latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm - the ordinary beings who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm.
And the noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm - when the knowledge of the dharmas of suffering has not yet arisen - possess them.
The ordinary beings and noble ones who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm.
And the noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm - when the knowledge of the dharmas of suffering has already arisen - do not possess them.
The latent tendencies eliminated by seeing the origin in the desire realm - ordinary beings who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm,
and noble ones who have not yet given rise to the cognition of the truth of the origin - possess them.
Ordinary beings and noble ones who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm,
and noble ones who have already given rise to the cognition of the truth of the origin - do not possess them.
The latent tendencies eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire realm - ordinary beings who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm,
and noble ones who have not yet given rise to the cognition of the truth of cessation - possess them.
Ordinary beings and noble ones who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm,
and noble ones who have already given rise to the cognition of the truth of cessation - do not possess them.
The latent tendencies eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm - ordinary beings who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm,
and noble ones who have not yet given rise to the cognition of the truth of the path - possess them.
Ordinary beings and noble ones who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm,
And the noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm - the knowledge of the dharmas of the path has already arisen - do not possess [the defilements].
The latent tendencies to be eliminated by cultivation in the desire realm - those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the desire realm - possess [them].
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the desire realm - do not possess [them].
The latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing suffering in the form realm - ordinary beings who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm,
and noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm - the knowledge of the aspects of suffering has not yet arisen - possess [them].
Ordinary beings and noble ones who have already abandoned the defilements of the form realm,
and noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm - the knowledge of the aspects of suffering has already arisen - do not possess [them].
The latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing the origin in the form realm - ordinary beings who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm,
and noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm - the knowledge of the aspects of the origin has not yet arisen - possess [them].
Ordinary beings and noble ones who have already abandoned the defilements of the form realm,
and noble ones who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm - the knowledge of the aspects of the origin has already arisen - do not possess [them].
The proclivities abandoned by insight in the form realm, not yet free from attachment to form, ordinary beings,
and not yet free from attachment to form, noble ones, the knowledge of the extinction class has not yet arisen, are possessed.
Already free from attachment to form, ordinary beings and noble ones,
and not yet free from attachment to form, noble ones, the knowledge of the extinction class has already arisen, are not possessed.
The proclivities abandoned by insight in the form realm, not yet free from attachment to form, ordinary beings,
and not yet free from attachment to form, noble ones, the knowledge of the path class has not yet arisen, are possessed.
Already free from attachment to form, ordinary beings and noble ones,
and not yet free from attachment to form, noble ones, the knowledge of the path class has already arisen, are not possessed.
The proclivities abandoned by cultivation in the form realm, not yet free from attachment to form, are possessed.
Already free from attachment to form, are not possessed.
The proclivities abandoned by insight in the formless realm, the knowledge of the extinction class has not yet arisen, are possessed.
Those that have already arisen are not possessed.
The latent tendencies eliminated by seeing the origin in the formless realm - when the knowledge of the origin of the class has not yet arisen, they are possessed.
Those that have already arisen are not possessed.
The latent tendencies eliminated by seeing cessation in the formless realm - when the knowledge of cessation of the class has not yet arisen, they are possessed.
Those that have already arisen are not possessed.
The latent tendencies eliminated by seeing the path in the formless realm - when the knowledge of the path of the class has not yet arisen, they are possessed.
Those that have already arisen are not possessed.
The latent tendencies eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm - those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the formless realm are possessed.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the formless realm are not possessed.
When the eye faculty up to the ignorance eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm are individually completely known,
among the ninety-eight latent tendencies, how many latent tendencies are completely known?
Among the nine fetters, how many fetters are exhausted?
Answer:ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
When the eye faculty is completely known, desire for form is ended.ğŸ”½Ordinary beings completely know thirty-one latent afflictions, but none are ended.
Noble ones completely know three latent afflictions, but none are ended.
The ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties are also like this.
When the female and male faculties are completely known, desire is ended.
Ordinary beings completely know thirty-six latent afflictions and end three bonds.
Noble ones completely know four latent afflictions and end three bonds.
The faculties of suffering and distress are also like this.
When the life faculty is completely known,
desire for the formless realm is ended.
three latent afflictions are completely known, and three bonds are ended.
The mind faculty, faculty of equanimity, and the faculties of faith, etc., are also like this.
When the faculty of pleasure is completely known, desire for the heaven of complete purity is ended.
immediately:
the faculty of pleasure is completely known, but no bonds are ended.
When the faculty of joy is completely known, the craving of the heaven of extreme radiance is eliminated.
That is to say:
When the faculty of joy is completely known, there is no bondage that is eliminated.
When the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, and tactile objects are completely known, craving for form is eliminated.
Ordinary beings completely know thirty-one latent afflictions, but there are no bonds that are eliminated.
Noble ones completely know three latent afflictions, but there are no bonds that are eliminated.

The eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, and tactile object realms, the form aggregate, the first five elements, phenomena with form, with visibility, and with resistance, and the form realm are also like this.
When the olfactory, gustatory, and tactile object realms are completely known, craving for the desire realm is eliminated.
Ordinary beings completely know thirty-six latent afflictions and eliminate three bonds.
Noble ones completely know four latent afflictions and eliminate three bonds.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
The same applies to the faculties of smell and taste, and to the unwholesome factors and factors bound to the desire realm.
When the faculties of eye, ear, and body consciousness are completely known, the craving of the Brahma world is exhausted.
Immediately:
The faculties of eye, ear, and body consciousness are completely known, but no fetters are exhausted.
When the faculties of mind, mental objects, and mind consciousness are completely known, the craving of the formless realm is exhausted.
Three latent tendencies are completely known, and three fetters are exhausted.

The same applies to the faculties of mind and mental objects, the last four aggregates, the four grasping aggregates, the consciousness element, the formless, the invisible, the unimpeded, the contaminated, the conditioned factors, the past, future, and present, the wholesome, the indeterminate, the factors bound to the form realm, that which is neither training nor post-training, and the factors to be abandoned by cultivation.
When the factors to be abandoned by the path of seeing are completely known:
Those who have not yet abandoned craving for the form realm - when the knowledge of the classes of the path is present.
Fourteen latent tendencies are completely known, and three fetters are exhausted.
Those who have already abandoned desire for the form realm, when the knowledge of the path is present,
seven proclivities are completely known, and three bonds are eliminated.
When the truths of suffering and accumulation are completely known,
desire for the formless realm is exhausted.
Three proclivities are completely known, and three bonds are eliminated.
The sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, the last two liberations, worldly cognition, and the three formless concentrations are also like this.
When the first meditation is completely known, desire for the Brahma world is exhausted.
Immediately,
the first meditation is completely known, and no bonds are eliminated.
When the second meditation is completely known,
desire for the extreme radiance is exhausted.
Immediately,
the second meditation is completely known, and no bonds are eliminated.
Immeasurable joy, the first liberation, and the first four excellent spheres are also like this.
When the third meditation is completely known, desire for the universal purity is exhausted.
Immediately,
At the time of realizing the third absorption, there are no fetters that are eliminated.
At the time of realizing the fourth absorption, desire for the form realm is exhausted.
For ordinary beings, thirty-one latent afflictions are realized, but there are no fetters that are eliminated.
For noble ones, three latent afflictions are realized, but there are no fetters that are eliminated.
The three immeasurables, the liberation of purity, the last four spheres of mastery, and the first eight spheres of totality, as well as the knowledge of others' minds, are also like this.
At the time of realizing the sphere of infinite space, desire for the sphere of infinite space is exhausted.
That is to say:
The sphere of infinite space is realized, but there are no fetters that are eliminated.
The liberation of the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of totality are also like this.
At the time of realizing the sphere of infinite consciousness, desire for the sphere of infinite consciousness is exhausted.
That is to say:
The sphere of infinite consciousness is realized, but there are no fetters that are eliminated.
The liberation of the sphere of infinite consciousness and the sphere of totality are also like this.
When the stage of nothingness attains thorough understanding, the craving for the stage of nothingness is exhausted.
That is to say:
The stage of nothingness attains thorough understanding, but no fetters are exhausted.
The liberation of the stage of nothingness is also like this.
When the fetter of the view of the body as real attains thorough understanding, the knowledge of the aspects of the truth of suffering is present:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm - eighteen latent afflictions attain thorough understanding, but no fetters are exhausted.
Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the form realm - nine latent afflictions attain thorough understanding, but no fetters are exhausted.
The lower fetter of the view of the body as real, the view of the body as real, and the view of holding a particular view as paramount are also like this.
When the fetters of clinging to precepts and vows and doubt attain thorough understanding, the knowledge of the aspects of the truth of the path is present:
Those who have not yet abandoned the defilements of the form realm - fourteen latent afflictions attain thorough understanding, and three fetters are exhausted.

Those who have already abandoned the defilements of the form realm - seven latent afflictions attain thorough understanding, and three fetters are exhausted.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:

The same applies to the seen, the flood, the yoke, the grasping, the grasping at precepts and vows, the last two fetters bound to the body, the last two lower fetters, the last three views, the latent tendencies of views and doubt, the fetters of views, grasping, and doubt.
When the three unwholesome roots and the desire-flood are completely known, desire is exhausted.
For ordinary beings, thirty-six latent tendencies are completely known and three fetters are exhausted.
For noble ones, four latent tendencies are completely known and three fetters are exhausted.

The same applies to the desire-flood, yoke, grasping, the first two fetters bound to the body, the first four hindrances, the fetters of anger, jealousy, and stinginess, the first two lower fetters, the bodily-based craving arising from nose and tongue contact, the latent tendencies of desire for sensual pleasure and anger, and the fetters of anger, jealousy, and stinginess.
When the existence-flood and ignorance-flood are completely known, attachment to the formless realm is exhausted, three latent tendencies are completely known, and three fetters are exhausted.

The same applies to the floods, yokes, and clingings of existence and ignorance, the fetters of pride and clinging, the last four ties to the higher states, the mind-contact-born craving and clinging, the latent tendencies of craving for existence, pride, and ignorance, and the fetters of craving, pride, and ignorance.

ordinary beings who have exhausted desire for the sense realm have thirty-six latent afflictions completely known and three fetters eliminated.

When attachment to the form realm is completely known, attachment to the Brahma realm is exhausted.

Noble ones have three latent afflictions completely known but no fetters eliminated.

three craving and clinging are completely known but no fetters are eliminated.

completely know thirty-six proclivities and end three bonds.

translated: When the eye faculty and the proclivities eliminated by cultivation in the formless realm are eliminated,ğŸ”½how many proclivities are eliminated?
How many bonds are eliminated?
The answer is:
When the eye faculty is eliminated,
when the desire for form is exhausted.
Ordinary beings - thirty-one latent afflictions cease to be manifested, but no fetters are eliminated.
Noble ones - three latent afflictions cease to be manifested, but no fetters are eliminated.

When the faculty of pleasure is extinguished and realized, the desire for the heaven of universal purity is exhausted.
â€”â€” Namely:

Ninety-eight latent afflictions are extinguished and realized, and nine fetters are ended.

the desire for the heaven of extreme radiance is exhausted.

The same applies to the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, and tangible object realms, the form aggregate, the form clinging aggregate, the first five elements, the form realm, the visible, the resistant, and the form realm-bound dharmas.
When the cessation of the olfactory and gustatory consciousness realms is realized, desire is exhausted.

desire for the Brahma world is exhausted.
This is:
The realization of the cessation of the three consciousness realms, with no bonds exhausted.
Up to the state of arhat.
The realization of the cessation of ninety-eight latent afflictions, with the exhaustion of nine bonds.
When the cessation of the mental faculty, dharmas, and mental consciousness are realized,
one attains the fruit of arhatship.
The cessation of the ninety-eight latent afflictions is realized, and the nine bonds are severed.

The mental faculty and dharma objects, the last four aggregates and four grasping aggregates, the consciousness realm, the formless, invisible, non-resistant, contaminated, conditioned dharmas, the past, future, and present, the wholesome, indeterminate, and form realm-bound, neither learner nor post-learner, and the dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation are also like this.
When the cessation of the dharmas to be eliminated by seeing is realized,
one attains the fruit of stream-entry.
The cessation of the eighty-eight latent afflictions is realized, and the three bonds are severed.

one attains the fruit of arhatship.

The same applies to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, the last two liberations, worldly cognition, and the three formless concentrations.

the craving of the Brahma world is exhausted.

one realizes the abandonment of the ninety-eight latent afflictions and severs the nine bonds.

Up to the state of arhatship,
one realizes the abandonment of the ninety-eight latent afflictions and severs the nine bonds.

the craving of the heaven of universal purity is exhausted.

At that time, the ninety-eight latent afflictions are eliminated and realized, and the nine bonds are severed.

craving for the form realm is exhausted.

When the sphere of infinite space is eliminated and realized,

the ninety-eight latent afflictions are eliminated and realized, and the nine bonds are severed.
